item.title: Four ways to supercharge your scatterplots
item.description: Scatterplots are a go-to visualization with forestry data. Scatterplots show the relationship between two quantitative variables measured on the same object. For example, a tree’s diameter and height. There are a few rules for all scatterplots: The explanatory variable goes on the x-axis. (This is usually the “easier” measurement to collect.) The response variable goes on the y-axis. (This is usually the “harder” measurement to collect.) Each observation is a point on the graph.
